Continue reading "Call for Extended Abstracts"
item.content:encoded:
We will accept extended abstracts (maximum two pages) of work-in-progress or recently published results.

The call for submission will begin in March 2022 through various mailing lists, and the abstracts will be due in April 2022. Each accepted abstract will be given a 5-min spotlight presentation and will be invited to present their posters during lunch and coffee breaks.

item.title: Poster Session
item.dc:creator: Zoe104Yao
item.description:

Continue reading "Poster Session"
item.content:encoded:
If you have registered this workshop and want to present in the poster session, please send your poster to nyao4@gmu.edu by May 21st. 

For the poster design, please feel free to choose any template/design available on the internet or provided by MS PowerPoint or even create your own poster design. Or you can use a poster template file, ‘posterTmp.ppt,’ in https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lHsKM7_P_fIf6rgexNbVW6LCNjGohJwg/view?usp=sharing

Consequently, participants must adhere to the poster font and dimension specification listed below to ensure the legibility of the posters.  Smaller font sizes that sufficed in physical poster presentation settings will appear as too small. 

Poster design specifications: 

  • Poster size: A0 (Landscape) 118.9 cm (width) by 84.1 cm (height). 
  • Title font-size: 100. 
  • Section headings font-size: 70. 
  • Paragraph text font-size: 45. 
  • Images and figures are preferred to be in vector graphics format to avoid pixilation. 
  • Final poster file must in an image format, e.g., JPG or SVG. However, export your poster as .SVG to avoid pixilation.
